laboratory_examinations.findings: Reduction of compound muscle action potential (CMAP) amplitude stimulating at the fibular neck; Distal CMAP amplitude of the right fibular nerve was relatively lower compared to the left side.
Decreased SNAP amplitude of the right superficial fibular nerve (2 mV, reference value 7 mV).

Revealed spontaneous activity in the form of positive sharp waves and fibrillation potentials; Motor unit action potential (MUAP) morphology was not indicative of denervation; motor unit recruitment was reduced.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Complete blood count, erythrocyte sedimentation rate, fasting blood glucose levels, hepatic and renal function tests

laboratory_examinations.findings: All tests, including antinuclear antibodies and rheumatoid factor, were negative.

A lobulated cystic mass of longitudinal diameter approximately 2.5 cm occupying the space between the proximal tibia and the fibular neck; low to intermediate signal intensity on T1-weighted images and high signal intensity on T2-weighted images.
